com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.drive

Class TwoTrackingWheelLocalizer

  • com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.drive.TwoTrackingWheelLocalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Localizer

    public class TwoTrackingWheelLocalizer
implements Localizer

    Localizer based on two unpowered tracking omni wheels and an orientation sensor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Localizer based on two unpowered tracking omni wheels and an orientation sensor.

      Localizer based on two unpowered tracking omni wheels and an orientation sensor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getHeading()
      Returns the heading of the robot (usually from a gyroscope or IMU).
      Pose2d getPoseEstimate()
      Current robot pose estimate.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getWheelPositions()
      Returns the positions of the tracking wheels in the desired distance units (not encoder counts!)

      Current robot pose estimate.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TwoTrackingWheelLocalizer

        public TwoTrackingWheelLocalizer(java.util.List<com.acmerobotics.roadrunner.Vector2d> wheelPositions,
                                 java.util.List<java.lang.Double> wheelOrientations,
                                 NanoClock clock)

        Localizer based on two unpowered tracking omni wheels and an orientation sensor.

        Parameters:
        wheelPositions - wheel positions relative to the center of the robot (positive X points forward on the robot)
        wheelOrientations - angular orientations of the wheels measured counterclockwise from positive X in radians
        clock - clock
        wheelPositions - wheel positions relative to the center of the robot (positive X points forward on the robot)
        wheelOrientations - angular orientations of the wheels measured counterclockwise from positive X in radians
        clock - clock

        Parameters:
        wheelPositions - wheel positions relative to the center of the robot (positive X points forward on the robot)
        wheelOrientations - angular orientations of the wheels measured counterclockwise from positive X in radians
        wheelPositions - wheel positions relative to the center of the robot (positive X points forward on the robot)
        wheelOrientations - angular orientations of the wheels measured counterclockwise from positive X in radians
